verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.esv: 6 Let your speech always be gracious, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how you ought to answer each person.
verses.kjv: 6 Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.
verses.niv: 6 Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone.

verses.esv: 11 it is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but what comes out of the mouth; this defiles a person.”
verses.kjv: 11 Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
verses.niv: 11 What goes into a man's mouth does not make him 'unclean,' but what comes out of his mouth, that is what makes him 'unclean.'"

verses.esv:
3   Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth;
    keep watch over the door of my lips!
verses.kjv: 3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
verses.niv: 3 Set a guard over my mouth, O LORD; keep watch over the door of my lips.

verses.esv:
15:1   A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
2   The tongue of the wise commends knowledge,
    but the mouths of fools pour out folly.
verses.kjv: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger. 2 The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
verses.niv: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger. 2 The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of the fool gushes folly.

verses.esv:
4   A gentle tongue is a tree of life,
    but perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
verses.kjv: 4 A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
verses.niv: 4 The tongue that brings healing is a tree of life, but a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit.

verses.esv:
23   Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue
    keeps himself out of trouble.
verses.kjv: 23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
verses.niv: 23 He who guards his mouth and his tongue keeps himself from calamity.

verses.esv:
24   Gracious words are like a honeycomb,
    sweetness to the soul and health to the body.
verses.kjv: 24 Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
verses.niv: 24 Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.

verses.esv: 4 Let there be no filthiness nor foolish talk nor crude joking, which are out of place, but instead let there be thanksgiving.
verses.kjv: 4 Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.
verses.niv: 4 Nor should there be obscenity, foolish talk or coarse joking, which are out of place, but rather thanksgiving.

verses.esv: 36 I tell you, on the day of judgment people will give account for every careless word they speak,
verses.kjv: 36 But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.
verses.niv: 36 But I tell you that men will have to give account on the day of judgment for every careless word they have spoken.

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger;
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

verses.esv: 26 If anyone thinks he is religious and does not bridle his tongue but deceives his heart, this person’s religion is worthless.
verses.kjv: 26 If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.
verses.niv: 26 If anyone considers himself religious and yet does not keep a tight rein on his tongue, he deceives himself and his religion is worthless.

verses.esv:
28   Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise;
    when he closes his lips, he is deemed intelligent.
verses.kjv: 28 Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
verses.niv: 28 Even a fool is thought wise if he keeps silent, and discerning if he holds his tongue.

verses.esv:
21   Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruits.
verses.kjv: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.niv: 21 The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

verses.esv:
20   From the fruit of a man’s mouth his stomach is satisfied;
    he is satisfied by the yield of his lips.
21   Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruits.
verses.kjv: 20 A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled. 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
verses.niv: 20 From the fruit of his mouth a man's stomach is filled; with the harvest from his lips he is satisfied. 21 The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

verses.esv:
14   Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable in your sight,
    O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.
verses.kjv: 14 Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
verses.niv: 14 May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing in your sight, O Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.

verses.esv: 9 With it we bless our Lord and Father, and with it we curse people who are made in the likeness of God. 10 From the same mouth come blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so.
verses.kjv: 9 Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God. 10 Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.
verses.niv: 9 With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse men, who have been made in God's likeness. 10 Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers, this should not be.

verses.esv:
3   Whoever guards his mouth preserves his life;
    he who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
verses.kjv: 3 He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
verses.niv: 3 He who guards his lips guards his life, but he who speaks rashly will come to ruin.

verses.esv:
15:1   A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.kjv: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.niv: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.esv: 45 The good person out of the good treasure of his heart produces good, and the evil person out of his evil treasure produces evil, for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
verses.kjv: 45 A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
verses.niv: 45 The good man brings good things out of the good stored up in his heart, and the evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in his heart. For out of the overflow of his heart his mouth speaks.

verses.esv:
27   Whoever restrains his words has knowledge,
    and he who has a cool spirit is a man of understanding.
verses.kjv: 27 He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
verses.niv: 27 A man of knowledge uses words with restraint, and a man of understanding is even-tempered.

verses.esv:
19   When words are many, transgression is not lacking,
    but whoever restrains his lips is prudent.
verses.kjv: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
verses.niv: 19 When words are many, sin is not absent, but he who holds his tongue is wise.

verses.esv: 36 I tell you, on the day of judgment people will give account for every careless word they speak, 37 for by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
verses.kjv: 36 But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment. 37 For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
verses.niv: 36 But I tell you that men will have to give account on the day of judgment for every careless word they have spoken. 37 For by your words you will be acquitted, and by your words you will be condemned."

verses.esv:
2  Be not rash with your mouth, nor let your heart be hasty to utter a word before God, for God is in heaven and you are on earth. Therefore let your words be few. 3 For a dream comes with much business, and a fool’s voice with many words.

4 When you vow a vow to God, do not delay paying it, for he has no pleasure in fools. Pay what you vow.
verses.kjv: 2 Be not rash with thy mouth, and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God is in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few. 3 For a dream cometh through the multitude of business; and a fool’s voice is known by multitude of words. 4 When thou vowest a vow unto God, defer not to pay it; for he hath no pleasure in fools: pay that which thou hast vowed.
verses.niv: 2 Do not be quick with your mouth, do not be hasty in your heart to utter anything before God. God is in heaven and you are on earth, so let your words be few. 3 As a dream comes when there are many cares, so the speech of a fool when there are many words. 4 When you make a vow to God, do not delay in fulfilling it. He has no pleasure in fools; fulfill your vow.

verses.esv:
18   There is one whose rash words are like sword thrusts,
    but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
verses.kjv: 18 There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
verses.niv: 18 Reckless words pierce like a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
